items.title: Abortion Pill Ploy During Hanky-Panky Leaves Courts Yawning!
items.summary: Today’s steaming pile of human garbage? David Coots, a Washington nurse practitioner who makes Charles Manson look like a fucking Cub Scout. This prick’s got five kids, a wife, and a mistress, but apparently, his real passion is playing “rogue pharmacist” with abortion pills. Let’s dive into this clusterfuck, shall we? So, Coots, this cockwomble with a skincare license, allegedly decided to spice up his mistress’s…
items.content_html:
Today’s steaming pile of human garbage? David Coots, a Washington nurse practitioner who makes Charles Manson look like a fucking Cub Scout. This prick’s got five kids, a wife, and a mistress, but apparently, his real passion is playing “rogue pharmacist” with abortion pills. Let’s dive into this clusterfuck, shall we?
 
So, Coots, this cockwomble with a skincare license, allegedly decided to spice up his mistress’s sex life by slipping abortion pills into her like it’s a fucking protein shake. Not Plan B, you dipshits—Plan “I’m a sociopathic fuckface.” And what happens? The court’s like, “Cool, Dave, ditch the ankle monitor. Go chase your esthetician dreams!” Because nothing screams “reformed” like a guy accused of medical assault launching Pores by Coots to fix your goddamn rosacea.
 
I mean, are you shitting me? This dude’s out here committing crimes so slimy they’d make a sewer rat gag, and the judge is like, “Just exfoliate gently, you magnificent bastard.” If that’s not America’s Next Top Psycho, I’ll chug a bottle of hand sanitizer. And let’s give a slow clap to the Washington Department of Licensing, who handed this creep a skincare license faster than you can say “we don’t do background checks, lol.” The victim’s begging to keep his ankle monitor on, screaming she’s scared shitless for her life, and the system’s like, “Chill, babe, his pores are popping!”
 
Then there’s Melissa, Coots’ wife. You’d think she’d be shredding his golf shirts or googling “how to poison a cheating asshole,” but nah. This genius tries to bribe the mistress with a pathetic $2,000 to zip it. Two grand? That’s not even enough for a decent vibrator to get over this trauma, Mel! Meanwhile, Coots is violating no-contact orders like it’s his fucking cardio, dropping flowers and love notes like he’s starring in Stalker: The Musical. Yo, Dave, nobody wants your dollar-store roses when you’re out here playing Dr. Evil with someone’s uterus.
 
The kicker? Justice is taking a nap, so Coots is free until his June hearing, probably perfecting his cucumber mask recipe and creeping out every woman in Gig Harbor. Pro tip: if a soft-handed, dead-eyed fuck offers you a facial in Washington, sprint like your ass is on fire. Check your drink, your IUD, and maybe your goddamn will to live.
This whole saga is why you need Get Bent in your life, folks. I’m here, half in the bag, serving truth so raw it’ll make your eyes bleed. Forget those pansy-ass news sites—grab a drink, get comfy, and let’s bend this fucked-up world together.
 
Look, you beautiful disasters, life’s a shitstorm, and creeps like Coots are why you gotta keep your guard up. Trust your gut, ditch the toxic assholes, and surround yourself with people who don’t make your skin crawl. Keep bending toward the good shit, and never stop fighting for what’s right. Now, if you’ll excuse me, I’ve got a date with a bottle of bourbon. Stay bent, stay safe, and for fuck’s sake, moisturize responsibly.
 
Vincent Skinwell, signing off with a middle finger and a dream.

items.title: When Pigs Fly… Back to Life
items.summary: A dead pig’s brain walks into a science lab… and almost remembers the punchline. Tonight, Vincent Skinwell breaks down a real-life Frankenstein moment straight out of Yale’s medical labs. Scientists revived a pig’s brain four hours after death using a mad-science brew called BrainEx—and things lit up. Neurons fired, proteins churned, and consciousness… thankfully stayed on vacation. But now the team’s doing it to human…
items.content_html:
A dead pig’s brain walks into a science lab… and almost remembers the punchline.

Tonight, Vincent Skinwell breaks down a real-life Frankenstein moment straight out of Yale’s medical labs. Scientists revived a pig’s brain four hours after death using a mad-science brew called BrainEx—and things lit up. Neurons fired, proteins churned, and consciousness… thankfully stayed on vacation. But now the team’s doing it to human brains, and the ethical klaxon is blaring louder than a Senate hearing.

From twisted science to political zingers, Skinwell takes aim at what it means to be “brain dead” in America today—the legal minefield of reanimated gray matter, and whether this tech might actually help cure diseases.

Tune in for the science, stay for the sarcasm. This episode’s got more brain activity than a cabinet meeting—and that’s saying something.

items.title: Greenland Grabbin’ and Canada Cravin’
items.summary: Vincent Skinwell returns to plow headfirst through a MAGA fever dream so bold it makes fan fiction look grounded. In this episode, we dive into Trump’s frosty fixation on buying Greenland—yes, again—and his bizarre side-eye at Canada as America’s “maybe” 51st state. From diplomatic delusion to a lumber superiority complex, we explore what happens when your foreign policy is built on Zillow listings and tanning…
items.content_html: Vincent Skinwell returns to plow headfirst through a MAGA fever dream so bold it makes fan fiction look grounded. In this episode, we dive into Trump’s frosty fixation on buying Greenland—yes, again—and his bizarre side-eye at Canada as America’s “maybe” 51st state. From diplomatic delusion to a lumber superiority complex, we explore what happens when your foreign policy is built on Zillow listings and tanning fumes. Grab a drink, dodge the gold-plated nonsense, and hang on—because it’s gonna get bent.

items.title: Make America Feudal Again? Trump’s New Spin on Poverty
items.summary: Vincent Skinwell dives into the latest economic absurdity coming out of the Trump camp: a full-throttle pitch that poverty is patriotic. With the economy tanking and store shelves emptier than ever, Trump’s team insists this is all part of the plan. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick dreams of generational factory work, while Treasury’s Scott Bessent shrugs off cheap goods like they’re luxury problems. Vincent calls BS—served…
items.content_html: Vincent Skinwell dives into the latest economic absurdity coming out of the Trump camp: a full-throttle pitch that poverty is patriotic. With the economy tanking and store shelves emptier than ever, Trump’s team insists this is all part of the plan. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick dreams of generational factory work, while Treasury’s Scott Bessent shrugs off cheap goods like they’re luxury problems. Vincent calls BS—served with bourbon, sarcasm, and a reminder that the American dream isn’t meant to look like a medieval reboot. Tune in, pour one, and don’t let the suits gaslight your wallet.

items.title: Thou Shalt Not Tinkle on Scripture
items.summary: Tonight on Get Bent, Vincent Skinwell tackles the golden stream of headlines surrounding a New Hampshire woman who’s made public urination her personal brand. Meet “Kinki Kelli,” an OnlyFans personality with a flair for fluid destruction—from grocery aisles to hotel Bibles. We unpack her bathroom-optional behavior, the hotel room fiasco that reads like a Mad Libs crime report, and what happens when your side hustle…
items.content_html: Tonight on Get Bent, Vincent Skinwell tackles the golden stream of headlines surrounding a New Hampshire woman who’s made public urination her personal brand. Meet “Kinki Kelli,” an OnlyFans personality with a flair for fluid destruction—from grocery aisles to hotel Bibles. We unpack her bathroom-optional behavior, the hotel room fiasco that reads like a Mad Libs crime report, and what happens when your side hustle involves felony-level bladder control issues.

items.title: Brain Tango: Sync Up or Shut Up
items.summary: Tonight on Get Bent, Vinny Skinwell stumbles onto some Princeton egghead science that proves your drunken bar ramblings might actually rewire someone’s brain. Welcome to the world of “neural coupling”—no, it’s not a weird sex act, it’s what happens when real conversations hit Level III status. Forget the weather talk and chest-thumping nonsense; if you’re honest, curious, and listen like you’re not planning your next…
items.content_html: Tonight on Get Bent, Vinny Skinwell stumbles onto some Princeton egghead science that proves your drunken bar ramblings might actually rewire someone’s brain. Welcome to the world of “neural coupling”—no, it’s not a weird sex act, it’s what happens when real conversations hit Level III status. Forget the weather talk and chest-thumping nonsense; if you’re honest, curious, and listen like you’re not planning your next nacho order, you can sync up minds faster than you can say “another round.” Join Vinny as he explores why real connection is rarer than a sober anchorman and why talking like you actually give a damn might just be the ultimate rebellion. Get ready to sip, sync, and maybe even seduce a few neurons along the way.

items.title: Toot Your Way to Better Health
items.summary: Tonight on Get Bent, Vince Skinwell blows the lid off a groundbreaking health trend: fart walks. Yes, folks, it turns out ripping a few tunes while waddling around the block might be the best thing you can do for your body since sliced bread—and way funnier. Join Vince as he explores how a little gas-powered cardio could save you from diabetes, cancer, and the eternal…
items.content_html: Tonight on Get Bent, Vince Skinwell blows the lid off a groundbreaking health trend: fart walks. Yes, folks, it turns out ripping a few tunes while waddling around the block might be the best thing you can do for your body since sliced bread—and way funnier. Join Vince as he explores how a little gas-powered cardio could save you from diabetes, cancer, and the eternal shame of a hospital gown draft. Whether you strut, shuffle, or full-on trombone your way down the sidewalk, science says you’re doing it right. So after dinner, don’t just sit there like a stuffed turkey—take a toot-trot and let freedom ring… from both ends.

items.title: Grandma’s Got a Body Count
items.summary: Tonight, Vincent Skinwell sets his sights on Florida’s latest nominee for Grandma of the Year: Tracy Nyx, whose babysitting résumé now reads like a horror film. After slow-roasting one grandkid in a hot car and losing another to an aquatic oopsie, she’s finally catching five years in prison—and somehow the debate is still about whether grandparents should babysit. Vincent isn’t here for your think pieces.
items.content_html: Tonight, Vincent Skinwell sets his sights on Florida’s latest nominee for Grandma of the Year: Tracy Nyx, whose babysitting résumé now reads like a horror film. After slow-roasting one grandkid in a hot car and losing another to an aquatic oopsie, she’s finally catching five years in prison—and somehow the debate is still about whether grandparents should babysit. Vincent isn’t here for your think pieces. He’s here to hand out rage with a side of sarcasm and remind folks that kids aren’t casseroles and pools aren’t pacifiers. Buckle up for a roast that hits harder than Florida sun on a closed windshield.

items.title: DMs by Drones, Dreams by Delusion
items.summary: Vincent Skinwell rips into tonight’s dumbest lawsuit—two OnlyFans addicts suing because their cyber-crushes turned out to be outsourced typists with no actual interest in their sad emoji-filled DMs. Boohoo, bros. You thought you were sexting soulmates, turns out you were just paying for glorified chatbots with cleavage. Vincent exposes the illusion, the fine print, and the fragile male ego in this brutal takedown of digital…
items.content_html: Vincent Skinwell rips into tonight’s dumbest lawsuit—two OnlyFans addicts suing because their cyber-crushes turned out to be outsourced typists with no actual interest in their sad emoji-filled DMs. Boohoo, bros. You thought you were sexting soulmates, turns out you were just paying for glorified chatbots with cleavage. Vincent exposes the illusion, the fine print, and the fragile male ego in this brutal takedown of digital delusion. Simps beware: this episode is your red flag and red pill rolled into one.

items.title: Your Fridge Is Judging You
items.summary: Tonight on Get Bent, your sarcastic overlord Vincent Skinwell hacks into Samsung’s kitchen circus of AI-infested appliances. From fridges that tattletale on your leftovers to touchscreens that doom-scroll while your dinner dies, it’s clear the future is now—and it’s annoying as hell. Are we really this lazy, or is Samsung just gaslighting us into dropping $3K on an oven with Wi-Fi and trust issues? Toss…
items.content_html: Tonight on Get Bent, your sarcastic overlord Vincent Skinwell hacks into Samsung’s kitchen circus of AI-infested appliances. From fridges that tattletale on your leftovers to touchscreens that doom-scroll while your dinner dies, it’s clear the future is now—and it’s annoying as hell. Are we really this lazy, or is Samsung just gaslighting us into dropping $3K on an oven with Wi-Fi and trust issues? Toss your kale, hug your dumb toaster, and join Vincent as he roasts the appliance apocalypse with the heat Samsung wishes it could deliver.
